column4: Hey People! I need a programm that shows every jpg in a folder and lets me either delete the current jpg and proceed to the next one or just proceed to the next one. Both with one keypress, so I can look through a lot of images fast. Would you guys write a bash script for that or use some existing app?
I would write a script...
how would you display the jpg?
display from imagemagick or whatever, there's a bunch of options
don't laugh, but you know what might do what you want: pornview
hmm.. no, i dont want an app with that name :)
sed s/pornview/gview/  in the source?
trying some other viewers first...
feh's man page claims to do this
(and works) I just confirmed
what is feh?
ok, installing that one too. is there any downside of installing lots of apps?
space on your hard drive
hmm.. feh is purely command line?
yeah
well it shows you the image obviously and then has some keybindings
ok, doing "man feh" now

feh is best so far. all i am missing is that i can overwrite existing files with a rotated version. because often the images have to be rotated. would be nice to be able to do that in the same process as to sort out which one to delete.
feh does this with <> :)
yes, feh rotates but it doesnt let you overwrite the file afterwards.
keep reading the page, you'll have to create it
